001-d-10-03-97-MNCW.Narrative: AUTO FOULED TRACKS & STRUCK TRAIN.  AT 1540 HOURS 3RD RAILMAN WORKING ON TRACK 3 IN MT VERNON REPORTED TO THE NEW HAVEN WEST END RTC THAT CAR IS ON THE TRACKS AT CAT. 16 FOULING TRACK 4.  IN ROUTE TOPELHAM AND NOTIFIED RTC THAT WOULD PROCEED TO MT VERNON.  IN ROUTE HEARD THAT 1340 WAS STOPPED AT NEW ROCHELLE AND REPORTING THAT THE CAR MUST HAVE HIT THEIR TRAIN BECAUSE THEY HAD DAMAGE TO CARS 9023& 8434 AND WERE REPORTING POSSIBLE INJURIES.  WHEN ARRIVED ON THE SCENE METRO PD HAD A HOLD ON ALLTRACKS AND 3RD RAIL POWER DE-ENERGIZED.  PASSENGER OF VEHICLE HAD ALREADY BEEN REMOVED FROM THE CARAND TRANSPORTED TO MT VERNON HOSPITAL.  THE VEHICLE INVOLVED WITH THIS INCIDENT HAD BEEN INVOLVED WITH A MOTOR VEHICLE ACCIDENT AT 4TH AVE AND 1ST STREET.  THE DRIVER OF VEHICLE HAD LOST CONTROL OF THE CAR, TRAVELED WEST ON 1ST STREET ABOUT 50' WEST OF INTERSECTION THEN JUMPED CURB TRAVELED THRU FENCE AND INTO TRAIN.  VEHICLE DAMAGED MAIN GROUND FOR SIGNAL FEEDERS AND OLD COMMUNICATION CABLE.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone

G4242-d-10-22-97-WC.Narrative: THE 1530 SWITCH CREW LET A CAR GO ONTO A CLEAR TRACK IN THE PROCESS OF SWITCHING.  THE CREW HAD MADEA MOVE TO 74 TRACK AND THEN TOOK A CUT FROM 58 TRACK AND BEGAN SWITCHING, THEY THEN THREW A CAR TO68 TRACK & LINED THE LEAD FOR THE 70'S.  THE CREW THOUGHT THE LEAD WAS LINED INTO 72 WHEN IN FACT ITWAS LINED FOR 74 TRACK WHICH WAS CLEAR.  THE CAR THAT HAD BEEN KICKED RAN DOWN 74 AND OUT THE EASTEND RUNNING THROUGH A NUMBER OF SWITCHES AND INTO THE SIDE OF TRAIN T043 AS IT ENTERED THE YARD.  NOCARS WERE DERAILED HOWEVER DAMAGE WAS SUSTAINED BY THE CAR KICKED INTO THE TRACK AND TO 2 CARS ON TRAIN T043.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

G4241-d-10-22-97-WC.Narrative: WC TRAIN, T218, CONSISTING OF 2 LOCOMOTIVES, 44 LOADS AND 1 EMPTY WAS SETTING UP THEIR TRAIN IN THEIC'S YARD ON TRACK #1 THE CREW HAD A HOLD OF 20 CARS ON TRACK #1 WHEN THEY BEGAN THEIR SHOVING MOVEMENT.  THE REMAINING 25 CARS WERE STANDING ON TRACK #2 AS THE CREW PROCEEDED WITH THE SHOVE MOVEMENT.THE CONDUCTOR WAS IN AN AUTOMOBILE, WITH THE TERMINAL MANAGER, PROTECTING THE SHOVE WHEN HE NOTICED THAT THE CROSSOVER WAS LINED INCORRECTLY.  THIS CAUSED THE FRONT HALF OF THEIR TRAIN ON TRACK #1 TO STRIKE THE REMAINING HALF ON TRACK #2.  THE TWO CARS THAT WERE STRUCK WERE THE ONLY ONES THAT WEREDAMAGED/DERAILED.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

G4239-d-10-14-97-WC.Narrative: TRAIN FY1972, CONSISTING OF 1 LOCOMOTIVE, 23 LOADS AND 15 EMPTIES WAS PERFORMING SWITCHING DUTIES WHEN PULLING OUT OF TRACK #8 IN THE GREEN BAY YARD AT APPROXIMATELY 10 MPH.  THE CREW HAD JUST GONE OVER THE INBOUND ROUND HOUSE SWITCH WHEN THE SECOND HEAD CAR PICKED AN IMPROPERLY LINED SWITCH.  THISCAR DERAILED ALONG WITH THE CAR IN FRONT AND BEHIND IT.  INVESTIGATION REVEALED THAT THE SECTION FOREMAN HAD BEEN INSPECTING THE SWITCH PRIOR TO FY1972'S MOVETMENT AND LINED THE SWITCH IMPROPERLY.  ANOTHER TRAIN HAD JUST GONE OVER THE SWITCH WITHOUT INCIDENT AHEAD OF THIS MOVE AND THE INSPECTION OFTHE SWITCH.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

G4240-d-10-16-97-WC.Narrative: TRAIN, T014 ,CONSISTING OF 3 LOCOMOTIVES, 28 LOADS & 52 EMPTIES WAS TRAVELING EAST THROUGH THE PLOVER YARD AT APPROX. 5 MPH WHEN ONE CAR DERAILED AT THE WEST WYE SWITCH AND THEN RERAILED ITSELF AT THEEAST WYE SWITCH.  THE CREW WAS NOT AWARE OF THE INCIDENT AT THE TIME.  TRAIN T013 DISCOVERED THE DAMAGE ON A WESTBOUND TRIP THROUGH THE PLOVER YARD. NO MECHANICAL DEFECTS WERE FOUND WITHTHE CAR/ WHEELS HOWEVER DUE TO THE DISTANCE THE CAR HAD BEEN DRAGGED, THE WHEELS WERE CHANGED OUT.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone
